data.title: Fresno State Athletics
data.meta_description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo. – The Mountain West is celebrating its 25th Season of excellence on and off the field of play. During each Mountain West Championship...
data.text:
COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo. – The Mountain West is celebrating its 25th Season of excellence on and off the field of play. During each Mountain West Championship in 2023-24, the Conference will recognize a 25th Season Team.

Among its 25 athletes for men's basketball is former Bulldog Marvelle Harris.

The 2016 Mountain West Player of the Year, Harris was a two-time All-MW selection and MW All-Defensive Team member. He finished his four-year career as Fresno State's all-time leading scorer with 2,031 points, a total at the time ranked No. 4 in conference history. He also concluded his career as Fresno State's all-time leader in free throws made (506), free throws attempted (678) and field goals attempted (1,595) and ranked second in program history in field goals made (667) and steals (207).

Harris turned in a historical season in 2015-16, leading Fresno State back to the NCAA Tournament for the first time since 2001 as the 'Dogs won the MW tournament, defeating San Diego State 68-63 in the championship game. That year he set single-season records for points scored (725), free throws made (179) and field goal attempts (589). He was just the third player in school history, joining Courtney Alexander and Melvin Ely, to earn preseason and postseason conference player of the year honors in the same season.

Mountain West Men's Basketball 25th Season Team

Chandler Hutchison, Boise State

Derrick Marks, Boise State

Rafael Araujo, BYU

Jimmer Fredette, BYU

David Roddy, Colorado State

Isaiah Stevens, Colorado State

Marvelle Harris, Fresno State

Jordan Caroline, Nevada

Caleb Martin, Nevada

Cody Martin, Nevada

Ruben Douglas, New Mexico

Danny Granger, New Mexico

Kendall Williams, New Mexico

Malachi Flynn, San Diego State

Jamaal Franklin, San Diego State

Brandon Heath, San Diego State

Kawhi Leonard, San Diego State

Xavier Thames, San Diego State

Marcus Banks, UNLV

Anthony Bennett, UNLV

Andrew Bogut, Utah

Sam Merrill, Utah State

Neemias Queta, Utah State

Hunter Maldonado, Wyoming

Larry Nance Jr., Wyoming

"Fresno State Athletics - Elevate: Imagine the Possibilities" - The Elevate Campaign provides a visionary roadmap to enhance and construct a series of athletic facilities to help further position Fresno State Athletics for sustained competitive success nationally, while also further serving as a source of pride and economic growth throughout California's Central Valley. For more information, visit GoBulldogs.com/elevate.
